intro: Cheiranthesimum, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Cheiranthesimum is often found in meadows and along stream banks, contributing to the biodiversity of these habitats.
